message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a scheduling problem, which is a classic topic in computer science and falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The use of LP-hierarchies is a common technique in approximation algorithms, which falls under the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also involves game theory (cs.GT) as it discusses the concept of approximation ratios. The recursive scheduling approach used in the paper involves graph theory and combinatorics, which falls under the category of computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper involves the analysis of the running time of the algorithm, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
